page.title: 05THE OAKHAM THEATRE
page.content: { } Oakham Theatre was originally an old wharf building at the end of the Oakham to Melton canal. It was converted into the Barraclough Hall in 1953. It didn't have very good facilities, so in 1984{OAKHAM SCHOOL decided to reconstruct it interior.The new theatre now has improved equipment such as: sound and lighting rooms, bars and fully equiped dressing rooms. Sloping upwards from the stage there are fixed seats. The theatre has a seating capacity for 220 people. The theatre was opened by the{ {QUEEN }in November 1984, (the school's quatercentenery).Since then a variety of plays and musicals have been performed.
